snippet: By the end of the decade, no single racial or ethnic group will constitute a majority of children under 18, census officials say.
abstract: Census Bureau projects that by end of current decade, no single racial or ethnic group in United States will constitute a majority of children under 18, and by about 2043, no single group will constitute a majority of the country as a whole; says as US grows more diverse, it is becoming 'plurality nation.'
lead_paragraph: By the end of the decade, no single racial or ethnic group will constitute a majority of children under 18, census officials say.

headline.seo: U.S. Will Have No Ethnic Majority, Census Finds
headline.main: Census Officials, Citing Increasing Diversity, Say U.S. Will Be a ‘Plurality Nation’
headline.print_headline: Census Officials, Citing Increasing Diversity, Say U.S. Will Be a ‘Plurality Nation’
